entries.meaning: (uncountable) Any solid substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
(uncountable, figuratively) Anything that nourishes or sustains.
(uncountable) Any solid substance that can be consumed by living organisms, especially by eating, in order to sustain life.
examples: The innkeeper brought them food and drink.
Synonyms: (archaic, now only humorous or regional) belly-timber, foodstuff, provender; see also Thesaurus:food

entries.meaning: (uncountable, figuratively) Anything that nourishes or sustains.
examples: The man's inspiring speech gave us food for thought.
Mozart and Bach are food for my soul.
